intro: Cryptophysa setosa, commonly known as the hairy cryptophysa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cryptophysa setosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
